Description: Fragment of a vessel: part of upright rim of shallow bowl, with a line of hieroglyphs incised within single line at top , double below. Base of bowl broken off on inner part of bottom of rim, but scar still visible. Egyptian blue dull blue surface, grainy texture, inside hard.
Curator's comments: Petrie illustrated this find and mentioned that it was discovered in the Scarab Factory: 'A piece of a rim of blue paste was found here' (Petrie 1886, 38, pl. XX, no. 9. Petrie suggested that other products than scarabs were manufactured this factory including New year's flask and possibly this Egyptian blue vessel (Petrie 1886, 37). Another fragmentary Egyptian blue inscribed vessel is now in the Egyptian Museum in Cairo (JE26771). Petrie, W.M.F. 1886, Naukratis. Part I, 1884–5 (Third Memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 38, pl. XX, no. 9)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (FA.12)
